results.headline: Review: ‘Ratchet & Clank,’ a Stale Tale Based on a PlayStation Game
results.summary_short: The movie has little story to tell and few ideas to offer, but a great deal of product to sell.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ratchet & Clank

results.headline: Review: ‘Sacrifice’ Yields Corpses and Clichés
results.summary_short: This thriller, directed by Peter A. Dowling and set in the Shetland Islands, relies overly on worn devices that are too often employed by the genre.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sacrifice

results.headline: Review: ‘Transfixed,’ a Real-Life Love Story, With Complications
results.summary_short: Alon Kol’s documentary tracks Martine and John, a couple with Asperger’s syndrome seeking to marry, as Martine hopes to undergo gender reassignment surgery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Transfixed

results.headline: Review: ‘Viktoria,’ a Family’s Atmospheric Voyage Through Change in Bulgaria
results.summary_short: Maya Vitkova’s satirical film opens with the birth of a girl who is designated “baby of the decade” by the state because of her lack of a bellybutton.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Viktoria

results.headline: Review: Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s Intense World and His Films
results.summary_short: A fellow filmmaker examines the work of this German director from the close perspective of friendship.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fassbinder: To Love Without Demands

results.headline: Review: In ‘Keanu,’ Key & Peele Break Baddish for a Beloved Kitty
results.summary_short: The duo star as hapless cousins who feign toughness to recover a pet from gang killers.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Keanu

results.headline: Review: ‘Eva Hesse’ Offers a Moving Portrait of an Artist’s Brief Life
results.summary_short: Marcie Begleiter’s documentary explores the originality and power of Hesse, who managed to triumph in a male-dominated art world before dying at 34.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eva Hesse

results.headline: Review: ‘Tale of Tales’ Adds Grown-Up Twists to the Fairy Tale
results.summary_short: This Matteo Garrone film is a colorful and kinky exploration of what women want. And what men will do to give it to them.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tale of Tales

results.headline: Review: ‘Keepers of the Game’ Sings of Young Women and Lacrosse
results.summary_short: Judd Ehrlich’s documentary chronicles a season in the life of the Salmon River Shamrocks, a Native American girl’s lacrosse team.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Keepers of the Game

results.headline: Review: ‘A Hologram for the King’ Is Elevated by Tom Hanks’s Portrayal of an American Everyman
results.summary_short: Set in Saudi Arabia, this subdued absurdist farce reflects on American decline and runaway technology.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Hologram for the King

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Meddler,’ a Yakkety Mom Comes of (a Certain) Age
results.summary_short: As a mother and daughter, Susan Sarandon and Rose Byrne portray a mother-daughter relationship that grows up.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Meddler

results.headline: Review: Basking in an Artist’s Sun in ‘Hockney’ Documentary
results.summary_short: This sunny film, with occasional clouds, looks at David Hockney’s life, his losses and his work’s reflections of his immersion in Southern California.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hockney

results.headline: Review: ‘Compadres,’ a Cross-Border Buddy Film
results.summary_short: A former Mexican police officer tracking down crime syndicate loot forms an alliance with a young American hacker who played a small role in moving it.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Compadres

results.headline: Review: In ‘Love Thy Nature,’ It Takes a Planet
results.summary_short: Sylvie Rokab’s film, narrated by Liam Neeson, advocates redefining the relationship between humans and the natural world.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Love Thy Nature

results.headline: Review: ‘Men & Chicken,’ a Gory and Quirky Danish Comedy
results.summary_short: Two brothers trek to a remote island to find their biological father, and slapstick violence ensues.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Men & Chicken

results.headline: Review: ‘Sworn Virgin’ Concerns a Fading Custom in Albania
results.summary_short: Hana has sworn off marriage, sex and parenthood to live as Mark.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sworn Virgin

results.headline: Review: A Grocery Chain, a Family Feud and a Win for Ordinary People
results.summary_short: This documentary, bursting with real-life superheroes who drive trucks and bag groceries, recounts the Market Basket uprising.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of We the People

results.headline: Review: Casting ‘Nina’ Was Controversial, but Is It a Good Movie?
results.summary_short: This biopic of Nina Simone was criticized for its choice of Zoe Saldana in the title role, but its problems are greater than that.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nina

results.headline: Review: In ‘Elvis & Nixon,’ Michael Shannon Holds Court as the King
results.summary_short: The director Liza Johnson recreates the meeting between the singer and the president, to which each brought his own agenda.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Elvis & Nixon

results.headline: Review: ‘The Huntsman,’ a Study in Hollywood’s Overstuffed Playbook
results.summary_short: Every resonant theme in this de-imaging of a fairy tale is stripped away, replaced with a ready-made franchise-movie conceit.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Huntsman: Winter’s War
